column1: Isn't it clear that the 1964 U.S. escalation in Vietnam lacked any legitimate justification?
Given Washington's provocative actions, wasn't the Soviet deployment of missiles to Cuba in 1962 a justified response to U.S. escalation?
Doesn't the 2003 U.S. invasion of Iraq obviously lack any adequate justification?
Isn't it undeniable that the U.S. use of atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in WWII was unnecessary?
Didn't the 1983 U.S. invasion of Grenada plainly lack any adequate justification?
Didn't the 1989 U.S. invasion of Panama lack any legitimate justification?
Isn't it evident that the USAAF's 1945 bombing of Dresden lacked any genuine military justification?
